The definition of a mendicant who is fre: When a mendicant has heard: ‘Nothing is worth insisting on.’
Directly knowing all things, they completely understand all things.
When they experience any kind of feeling—pleasant, unpleasant, or neutral— they meditate observing impermanence, dispassion, cessation, and letting go in those feelings.
Meditating in this way, they don’t grasp at anything in the world.
Not being anxious, they personally become extinguished.
They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
The description of the Palace of Victory: The Palace of Victory has a hundred towers.
Each tower has seven hundred chambers.
The actions of Venerable Mahāmoggallāna: Venerable Mahāmoggallāna vanished from the Eastern Monastery and reappeared among the gods of the Thirty-Three.
Moggallāna used his psychic power to make the Palace of Victory shake and rock and tremble with his big toe.
Knowing that Sakka was shocked and awestruck, Moggallāna asked him how the Buddha briefly explained freedom through the ending of craving.
Moggallāna approved and agreed with what Sakka said and then vanished from among the Gods of the Thirty-Three and reappeared in the Eastern Monastery.
